programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: When an old-timer gets into trouble with his lines, Troy answers the code of the swamp and lends him a hand.

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: Tom returns to the field on a rescue mission. The deep freeze leaves Morgan and Margaret scrambling for water.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team examines new evidence relating to strange noises and orange lights that caused alarm in Indiana in 2008, and considers theories that say it was a military jet.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz are delighted when they visit a house packed with rare collectibles - but are less pleased by the prices the owner is asking for them.

programme.title: Barter Kings
programme.sub-title: There's Snow Time Like Trading Time
programme.desc: As Steve and Antonio settle into their new Utah trade shop, they're inspired to trade up to something they never see in the High Desert: a heavy duty snowcat! But they have to track down a rare military vehicle to make it to their goal..

programme.title: Barter Kings
programme.desc: To help Steve train for an upcoming match, the guys need to find an MMA cage, but the real fight comes from another trader trying to knock them out of the deal.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick challenges a new painter to prove his skills in a contest with Countign Cars' Horney Mike, and a client brings in a 1970s wet bike.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A new picker goes out on his first trip, while Rick tries to fix up a 1950s ice cream cart.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth finds himself in the cross hairs after his new employee makes a big mistake, while Ashley is forced to face one of her most insulting customers yet.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: As a storm threatens to knock out the shop's power, Seth hatches an emergency plan - only for it to be shot down by his father.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz explore a warehouse belonging to country musician Mickey Gilley, and find a sign used in the movie Urban Cowboy.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zachary Quinto searches for and tests several possibilities that may explain the mystery and phenomena of Superhuman strength.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Examining reports of an alleged alien craft in Texas in 1897, investigating whether an extraterrestrial body was buried in a local graveyard.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick gets the chance to restore a Nasa jet pack signed by Buzz Aldrin and a client brings in a Second World War bomb.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick turns a cigarette machine into a device for holding bike tools, and Tyler plans to buy a rare 1950s pedal-powered bulldozer.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys haggle over the price of a rare mandolin, a 1950s woodworking machine and the business card of a famous outlaw.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are offered puppets from Buffalo Bill's Wild West Show and a yearbook containing a letter bearing the signature of one-time US president Ronald Reagan.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Auctions in Lake Elsinore bring treasures for some and turmoil for others, Dave causes trouble for his rivals, and Rene and Jarrod go head to head.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to auctions in Santa Ana, and once back on familiar turf, Dave Hester makes the others fight for a decent locker.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth finds himself in the cross hairs after his new employee makes a big mistake, while Ashley is forced to face one of her most insulting customers yet.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: As a storm threatens to knock out the shop's power, Seth hatches an emergency plan - only for it to be shot down by his father.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: After a rigorous first round qualifier, two bladesmiths will compete to make one of the most lethal weapons in military history, the Nepalese Kukri.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Experts contemplate whether an advanced civilisation of giants built Malta's mysterious megaliths, with the native people having only limited involvement. Presented by Giorgio Tsoukalos.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Investigating a theory that there was more than the previously alleged single UFO crash site in Roswell, New Mexico.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Actor Zachary Quinto hosts this reboot of the 1970s documentary series that explores the unexplained. He begins with a search for extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les's relationship deteriorates further as a string of problems in the warehouse threatens to bleed the business dry.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les discovers Seth's master plan for a new business structure at the Gold family pawn shop, leading to a huge stand-off between father and son.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Too Many Cooks in the Locker
programme.desc: The buyers try their luck at auctions in Lancaster, where Mary chooses a surprising ally. Meanwhile, Jarrod and Brandi turn up the pressure.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave threatens to dampen high spirits at an early morning auction, and Mary struggles to stop the other buyers from getting her down.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: North v South
programme.desc: The Northern boats go all out in the hope of reeling in their share of the tuna quota. Is today the day they make their 550-mile gamble worthwhile?.

programme.title: Football: A Brief History by Alfie Allen
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Game of Thrones actor sets off around the UK to explore the defining moments and turning points in the establishment of football in the UK.

programme.title: Greatest Moments in Football
programme.desc: A countdown of seven of the most spectacular and important goals in football history.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Auctions in Lake Elsinore bring treasures for some and turmoil for others, Dave causes trouble for his rivals, and Rene and Jarrod go head to head.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to auctions in Santa Ana, and once back on familiar turf, Dave Hester makes the others fight for a decent locker.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Mrs Brown star Brendan O'Carroll, comedian Bob Mortimer and Countdown numbers expert Rachel Riley tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. Their gripes include urinal etiquette, food with bacon wrapped round it and the Essex girl stereotype.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites another three celebrities to reveal their pet hates in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Veteran entertainer Des O'Connor reveals how he doesn't care for birthdays any more, broadcaster Adrian Chiles admits that women's shoes aren't for him and former Radio 1 Chart Show presenter Jameela Jamil isn't too keen on flatmates.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Alan, Jason Manford, Jo Joyner, Joe Lycett and the Reverend Richard Coles talk Christmas. Contains Strong Language and Mature Themes.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Sarah Millican, Jason Manford and Bill Bailey join regular panellist Alan Davies on the comedy quiz. Host Stephen Fry asks a range of fiendish questions on the topic of keeps, with points being awarded for interesting answers as well as correct ones.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Rob Beckett, Milton Jones, Ellie Taylor and Josh Widdicombe join regular panellists Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons to give their irreverent takes on the biggest stories to hit the headlines, through stand-up spots and improvised games. Chaired by Dara O Briain. From 2015.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Thanks to back flips and rail rides, Tim and Gendle are in BMX bike heaven. With the clock ticking it is down to Joe and the build team to construct the ultimate BMX set-up.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Keith gets lost on the roads of Derbyshire looking for a wanted man. He spots a dodgy van driver who is on the road without insurance, and is forced to make a crucial decision.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys have an awkward encounter with the 'King of the Gypsies', who has an incredible underground stash but insists he cannot be bought.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon Bernier and his wife Lori find a piece of rock 'n' roll history.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Former boxer Brandon Bernier bids against his arch-rival Jesse on a movie monster.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: When Frank goes nuts for a century-old snack icon, he must decide if it is worth an unprecedented sum of money to take it home.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys find themselves in dangerous territory when they pick the collection of a Harley enthusiast. Plus, Dave unveils Mike's biggest-ever investment.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: A client needs improvements on his SUV to get him to his off-the-grid cabin. Apart from arriving in one piece, his biggest concern is running out of gas to power his generator.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: The rough dirt roads of Labrador are no place for a high-powered sport bike, so a local rock n' roller gets Corey and Collin to transform it into a rip-roaring dirt bike.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May immerse themselves in nostalgia and try to prove that hot hatches from their younger days are better than today's equivalents. Jeremy grabs the keys to a Volkswagen Golf GTI, Richard takes the wheel of a Vauxhall Nova SRi and James May opts for the Ford Fiesta XR2i, and the trio set off on a road trip that includes a hill climb and a visit to a supermarket. However, their adventure concludes at an army training ground in Wales, where they and their steeds must face the heavily armed Top Gear Police Department. Downton Abbey star Hugh Bonneville blasts the Reasonably Priced Car around the test track.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: A local sawmill operator lands a job clearing trees off a property in town and needs Corey and Collin's help to get his 1970 Massey Ferguson tractor up and running.

programme.title: Last Stop Garage
programme.desc: When Old Man Winter blasts into Labrador without warning, a nearby Nordic Ski Club needs to get their rescue sled operational in a hurry.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Austin, Eddie Hall takes on Superbike legend Colin 'Texas Tornado' Edwards in a strength vs speed race - and sets his own eating challenge from eight of the city's food trucks.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Manhattan, Eddie Hall goes head to head with long-time rival Brian Shaw, pulling a 23-tonne truck - and attempting the notorious skyscraper 'Monster' sandwich from Sarge's Deli.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three petrolheads demonstrate their love of small cars with a trip to Ukraine. Jeremy Clarkson chooses a Volkswagen Up for the journey, while Richard Hammond takes a Ford Fiesta and James May opts for a Dacia Sandero. On their adventure, the trio absorb the history of the Crimean Peninsula, including a visit to an old submarine pen - but the carefree exploration looks likely to become a chore when Jeremy, Richard and James are challenged to a long drive north through the expansive country, during which they must combat serious boredom. And as if that wasn't arduous enough, a new task is set when they arrive in Kiev - a trip into the wasteland of Chernobyl. This edition also features a track test of the Danish Zenvo ST1 supercar and James Blunt returns for another drive in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson heads to Italy to get behind the wheel of the exclusive, hand-crafted Alfa Romeo Disco Volante, which is made by coachbuilder Touring Superleggera and based on the manufacturer's already rare 8C Competizione sports car. Richard Hammond asserts authority over the sand dunes of Abu Dhabi in the six-wheel-drive Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG 6x6, while James May defies his status as Captain Slow by blasting two Caterhams around the test track - the minimalist entry-level Seven 160 and the full-fat supercharged Seven 620R. Comedian Jack Whitehall sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Mrs Brown star Brendan O'Carroll, comedian Bob Mortimer and Countdown numbers expert Rachel Riley tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. Their gripes include urinal etiquette, food with bacon wrapped round it and the Essex girl stereotype.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites another three celebrities to reveal their pet hates in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Veteran entertainer Des O'Connor reveals how he doesn't care for birthdays any more, broadcaster Adrian Chiles admits that women's shoes aren't for him and former Radio 1 Chart Show presenter Jameela Jamil isn't too keen on flatmates.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Katy Brand, Ed Gamble, Suzannah Lipscomb and Amol Rajan join team captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe to answer questions about famous people who share the name Paul, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker. Sue Perkins hosts.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Ed Byrne, Angela Barnes, Geoff Norcott
programme.desc: Ed Byrne plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He warms up the audience and then introduces routines by Angela Barnes and Geoff Norcott.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.sub-title: Shot Through the Face with a Canon
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and mischievous games, Dave invites Katherine Ryan, Suzi Ruffell and Rufus Hound to help him make sense of our insensible world.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Ed Byrne, Sara Pascoe, James Acaster and Gary Delaney join regular panellists Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons to give their irreverent takes on the biggest stories to hit the headlines, through stand-up spots and improvised games. Chaired by Dara O Briain. First aired in 2015.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites satirist Charlie Brooker, presenter Scarlett Moffatt and actress Pearl Mackie to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include crocodiles, mosquitoes and having one's hair cut.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: One of the largest Nazi bunkers ever constructed, outside the French town of Watten, a missile facility with storage for 108 missiles, a liquid oxygen factory and two launch pads.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ghostly house in a tropical paradise that is still feared by the locals and a pioneering complex marked by both glory and tragedy that will soon to be lost forever.

programme.title: Find My Past
programme.desc: Descendants of three key players in the mutiny on the Bounty in 1789 - John Fryer, Fletcher Christian and William Bligh - learn the exact roles their seafaring ancestors played in the event. Presented by Chris Hollins.

programme.title: Find My Past
programme.desc: The families of three men hear the stories of their relatives' roles in the D-Day landings of June 1944 in Normandy.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Machines of War
programme.desc: Advances in weapons technology, beginning with the cruise missile, revealing how it took engineers decades to perfect launching a missile from the ocean.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: After the death of Cardinal Wolsey in 1530, Thomas Cromwell became Henry VIII's 'lap dog'. In order to do the king's bidding, he established a network of spies that steered Henry through his troubles with Rome, divorces, assassinations attempts and the establishment of a new religion. as this documentary reveals, though cunning and ambitious, none of these achievements proved sufficient to preserve his life.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The archaeologists get an opportunity to dig at an army firing range in High Ham, Somerset, to investigate a set of Roman mosaics first discovered 150 years ago. Initial searches suggest the remains of Roman villas could be located on the site, and the team begins to build up a picture of the highs and lows of life in the society of the time - until the cold weather threatens to bring the excavation to a premature halt. Presented by Tony Robinson.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson gets to choose a site for investigation and decides to take the team to Jersey, where a German anti-aircraft battery was built during the Second World War. As the experts explore the area, they realise it contained a large and complex settlement, and discover shocking facts about the islanders' suffering during the war.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Featuring Churchill's plan to create a giant ship out of ice, ghost planes that fly themselves, and a Nazi treasure hunt.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A closer look at a sprawling Wild West ghost town that sits peaceful and abandoned in Montana, USA, but is still haunted by tales of murder, corruption and buried treasure.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson gets to choose a site for investigation and decides to take the team to Jersey, where a German anti-aircraft battery was built during the Second World War. As the experts explore the area, they realise it contained a large and complex settlement, and discover shocking facts about the islanders' suffering during the war.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores nature's evolutionary anomalies and examines creatures whose stretched features have given them an edge in the natural world.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how fleas are able to jump great distances for their size and attempts to discover how fast a cheetah can run.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an insight into the most successful animals on the planet. Observing an Arctic fox stalk prey in its -20C environment, he reveals warm-bloodedness as one of the key factors in the mammals' global domination. He also studies marsupials in Australia and Central America, offering a unique view inside a platypus's breeding burrow.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The history of pioneering modern-day mega structures, revealing that behind every seemingly impossible marvel of modern engineering is a cast of historic trailblazing engineers who designed new building techniques, took risks on untested materials and revolutionised their field. The first programme focuses on the aircraft carrier.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Featuring Churchill's plan to create a giant ship out of ice, ghost planes that fly themselves, and a Nazi treasure hunt.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A vast project in the icy wilderness of southern Alaska, and a landscape of confusing and surprising structures that represented a bold statement of Spain's plans for the future.

programme.title: Queen Elizabeth's Secret Agents
programme.desc: The docudrama focuses on the machinations of ambitious aristocrat the Earl of Essex as he tries to take over Robert Cecil's spy network in an attempt to gain control over the ageing Elizabeth I and hold the power to choose the next king of England.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Great Central Railway's Scott Manley takes a rainy busman's holiday working as a guard at Bury, while a team of volunteers in Wales try to keep the line clear of overgrown plants.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The story of the Nazi quest to establish an Aryan race, which set out to subjugate the Jewish population with decrees and laws about citizenship and escalated to the use of execution camps and the horrors of the Holocaust. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Harris accidentally drops stolen pills into Fletcher's midday cuppa - much to the annoyance of prison racketeer Harry Grout, who resents a newcomer muscling in on his patch. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher objects to having a third cellmate foisted on him, especially as the newcomer seems to enjoy special privileges and the full backing of the wardens. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team is called in to investigate when a convicted killer is cleared of the murder of his adoptive father on appeal. Not fully convinced the man is innocent, Boyd tries to find the rest of the family to establish the truth, but when he does eventually track the relatives down, he realises they have a lot to hide. Drama, starring Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston and Claire Goose.

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: The detective oversteps the mark and finds himself sent back to the Police Training College to learn some professional etiquette and save his pension. Sidekick DS Siobhan Clarke is left to investigate the murder of an art dealer, but it is not long before her boss turns up on the trail of the killer. Ken Stott stars in the crime drama, with Claire Price and Jennifer Black.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits a Japanese-style horticultural haven in St Mawgan, Cornwall - open to the public under the National Gardens Scheme - complete with oriental plants including bamboo and bonsai.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters are torn between a prestigious job offer in Paris and their fashion house, and Jack creates another dilemma by asking Beatrice to marry him. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet, Aden Gillett, Louise Lombard and Barbara Jefford.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The fusiliers are brought in to collect rubbish due to a national strike, and CSM Chick Henwood finds his loyalties tested as his brother is one of the strikers.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy and Dave plan a betting scam when the top boxer Corporal Tony Wilton is knocked out of the team, but their scheme falls apart when Wilton is recalled.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Tom tries to boost his reputation by undertaking a new procedure on an asthmatic patient with severe angina, but Zubin is furious he was kept in the dark about the operation. Rosie is forced to confront her true feelings for Mubbs when she discovers he has an interview at another hospital and could be leaving soon, while love is also in the air for Owen and Lisa after he invites her back to his place for a nightcap.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gary is sent on an undercover mission to ferret out information about his estranged brother Joe's criminal activities - but CID soon have reason to suspect family ties could undermine his loyalty to the force. Meanwhile, as June fights for life in hospital, Jim makes some pointed remarks to Tony that leave him in an agony of guilt and remorse.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gary hunts for Joe, desperate to find his fugitive brother before the vengeful gangsters get their hands on him, but dramatic developments make him wonder if he's been manipulated all along. Elsewhere, as Tony comes to terms with the enormity of what he's done, a witness comes forward accusing him of reckless driving, while Jim is moved to declare his true feelings for June.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: A shadowy figure, the flash of knife - and tragedy strikes in Albert Square. An unwelcome letter causes Dot to panic, but who can she turn to for help?.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Dazed by the discovery of a murder on their doorstep, the inhabitants of Albert Square are interrogated by the police. Can they all account for their movements on that night?.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Mike learns the hospital is being sued by the son of a woman wrongly diagnosed by Daniel, while workmen in the department upset Rachel with their constant sexist comments. A vicar is admitted after an attempted suicide and it transpires a gay liberationist was threatening to reveal his sexuality. Clive Mantle and Jane Gurnett star.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Madly in love with one of Lady Jane's old school friends, Lovejoy finds it hard to keep his mind on work and mistakes a set of fake watercolours for the real thing. While he's off trying to put matters right, Eric takes charge of furnishing Dalrymple's stately home - with disastrous results. Joanna Lumley guest stars.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Two corpses are discovered in the sea, and Jim is puzzled to learn one has only been dead a few hours, while the other drowned 40 years before. John Nettles, Cecile Paoli and Terence Alexander star.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Lilo Lill is back at the allotment with Freddie, while Nellie has been visiting an art gallery with Derek. Shifty has a surprise for Marina.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: As Mrs Slocombe's marriage to a bouzouki-playing Greek approaches, the Grace Brothers staff plan her wedding reception.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth cannot suppress her excitement when she hears Emmet is rehearsing an amateur production of The Boyfriend, and resolves to land herself a part in the show. Suburban sitcom, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and David Griffin.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: In Which Gavin Hinchcliffe Loses the Gulf Stream
programme.desc: After seeing a man skiing on a van roof, the pals are intrigued to discover it is Gavin Hinchcliffe, an old friend renowned for his eccentricity. Comedy series, guest starring Bernard Cribbins, with Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Josephine Tewson.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: When an animal activist is killed on the first day of duck-hunting season, Mike and the team must determine whether it was an accidental shooting, or something more sinister.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the murder of an East German immigrant, but all they have to go on are his mysterious final words, which translate as 'blue flower'. As they piece together his remarkable story, Sandra tries to gain the trust of his estranged daughter. Crime drama, starring Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: An ageing confectionery company owner is found dead in his London hotel suite, and while Nikki tries to convince the sceptical DS Gold he was murdered, several businessmen begin to circle as it turns out the dead man was losing a desperate fight to prevent the sale of his company to investors. Feature-length episode of the crime drama, starring Emilia Fox, William Gaminara and David Caves, with guest appearances by Tim Pigott-Smith, Sharon Small and Priyanga Burford.

programme.title: Path To Power
programme.desc: Mark Austin is on the road presenting live from a different location around Britain in the run up to the General Election. With reaction to the election campaign and all the day's main news from home and abroad.

programme.title: Police, Camera, Auction
programme.desc: An insight into the auctions where criminals' assets from their nefarious activities are sold at auction, with the proceeds usually going to help those whose lives have been blighted by crime. From sports cars and designer goods to outrageous bling and strange collectibles, cameras reveal the broad range of criminals' possessions seized by specialist police teams and put under the hammer.The auctioneers and police discuss their work, while those victims who will benefit from the money wait anxiously to see the outcome of the sales.

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: Dating show, hosted by Holly Willoughby, which puts the love lives of singletons in the hands of the people they know best - their mum and dad. Each week, one man and one woman must choose from three potential partners, with their decisions solely based on an encounter with the contestants' parents.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom..

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom..

programme.title: This Morning

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and topical studio discussion from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson helps members of the public in Buxton, Derbyshire. Dealer Simon Schneider shows off his ventriloquism skills, and Tim Hogarth is impressed by an unusual telephone.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Sanjeev Bhaskar in which players four contestants can accumulate big cash totals by answering questions in a series of rounds that alternate between easy and hard, before one gets to the final stage and the chance to double the prize pot.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: An election broadcast by one of the political parties.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Long-running drama with the residents of England's most famous cobbled street.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show
programme.desc: Britain is becoming a nation of switchers, with nearly six million people changing their service suppliers last year. The big six energy companies are now dropping prices - so the demand for better deals is increasing. In this edition devoted to the topic, Martin and Angellica Bell offer advice and reveal the best deals.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Long-running drama with the residents of England's most famous cobbled street.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the celebrity survival challenge, which sees a group of famous faces living in the Australian jungle, struggling to complete the tough daily tasks and dreaded Bushtucker Trials. The campmates are tired, hungry and homesick, but need to keep winning stars - and food - if they are going to make it to the end.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Piers meets Caitlyn Jenner, who for the first 65 years of her life was known as Bruce, a former Olympic gold medal-winning decathlete. Looking back at her remarkable life, she opens up about her feud with her ex-wife and stepchildren in the Kardashian family, reflects on winning Olympic gold while simultaneously battling gender issues and discusses the death of her younger brother.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jonny Smith and Jason Plato try to find a decent new car for just 10,000. Vicki Butler-Henderson checks out the new Lamborghini Urus, and the team finds the biggest BMW ever made, the new X7.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restores two Royal Worcester vases that are precious family heirlooms, along with a Cirencester village clock and a 19th-century hay press.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team works to restore a clapping monkey toy, an ornate Victorian travelling treasure box, and an iconic 1950s Wurlitzer jukebox.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini visits the collection of deceased car dealer Lee Roy Hartung and finds original motorcycles at an auction.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini visits the Lee Roy Hartung collection, where he discovers an original Hertz car from the 1920s and a one-off 1949 Veritas.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: A comedic compilation of the craziest drivers. Featuring reckless pedestrians, the Bonneville Salt Flats, casual collisions and more outrageous stunts.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: A comedic compilation of some of the most daring drivers who take speed to the next levels. Featuring unusual pedestrians and a party on wheels like no other.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: An extreme skier is swept up in an avalanche, window washers cling on for their lives during a violent storm and Robbie Knievel's motorbike stunt goes wrong in Hawaii.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A military helicopter loses power and slices through the deck of a naval destroyer, and a racecar narrowly misses another competitor when it cartwheels across a track in Italy.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill Carlton and his team customise a F350 with less than 600 miles on it, lowering it with a handmade air-ride and adding a one-of-a-kind hitch.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: The A-Team restores a 1967 Camaro bought at auction by a man who thought he got a great deal, only to realise the restoration project was well beyond his budget and expertise.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The technological advances that allow crews to be rescued from disabled submarines, cars to run on waste beer and 100 tons of soil to be shifted with a single scoop.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Documentary exploring mysterious objects and events caught on Nasa's cameras. When astronaut Leroy Chiao's high-risk spacewalk is interrupted by bright lights, a major investigation is launched to uncover what caused them.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The crews face a race against the clock to catch as much crab as possible and earn enough money to cover their costs and wages, before the midnight deadline which marks the end of the season. The challenges of heavy seas and inexperience make their task more difficult and luck runs out on one boat when mechanical problems put an end to their endeavours.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Kellie and Henri face trouble in the form of breakdowns and bandits, and a failed plan sees the Gold Gypsies run out of time and options. Plus, the Dirt Dogs uncover a huge find.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Driver Steve Grahame discovers his vehicle has taken a battering during the past three days, over which he has hauled 130 tons of goods across 2,000km.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restores two Royal Worcester vases that are precious family heirlooms, along with a Cirencester village clock and a 19th-century hay press.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team works to restore a clapping monkey toy, an ornate Victorian travelling treasure box, and an iconic 1950s Wurlitzer jukebox.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini bids on a 1949 BMV Veritas and hopes to get a classic Thor motorbike up and running.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini visits McPherson College looking for three apprentices to join his team. The students assemble a Model T and the winners are announced.

programme.title: Mysteries of the Missing
programme.desc: Scientists, researchers and folklorists aim to make use of the latest technology to discover the truth about the mythical city of Atlantis, and its legendary disappearance.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The final week of gold season arrives, and the Dirt Dogs gamble big to hit their target. Meanwhile, Kellie and Henri mount a last-chance hunt.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The start of the potentially lucrative opilio crab season sees 171 boats heading out from Dutch Harbour, Alaska, to hunt them for profit. But shortly after setting off, the Lady Alaska crew discovers smoke on the vessel, forcing Captain Peter Liske to turn around and seek repairs. Meanwhile, companion boat the Big Valley is beset by troubles of its own.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: The fleet fights for its season goals, with Captain Vernon Adkison and Captain Emily Riedel looking for last-minute recruits.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to a huge antiques wholesaler in Exeter, where he finds pile upon pile of affordable gems. Next, it's on to north London, to visit an emporium of curiosities.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Turbo embarks on a journey through an area affected by bush fires, and Yogi faces the biggest week of his career.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer purchases a Mini Moke, which was designed as an off-road military vehicle, for expert mechanic Edd China to work on - before trying to sell it for a profit.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: In South Australia, rookie miners Daniel Becker and Justin Lang leave their lives behind, risking all to chase an opal fortune.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Margate, Kent, Drew Pritchard snaps up a good deal at a 'junk emporium' run by some of his best contacts. At a Georgian mansion in Fife, he finds a surprising bargain.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Russell's 30-year-old truck feels the strain on a run from Alice Springs to central Queensland. Meanwhile, Sludge wrestles flooded roads to deliver fuel to farmers.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Railroad
programme.desc: Winter may be over, but spring presents a whole new set of dangers on the Rocky Mountain railroad. Lethal rockslides threaten Canadian Pacific's longest and heaviest train.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The construction of Formula One racing cars, America's best-selling multi-tool and Finnish Aalto glassware.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The rounding up of escaped pythons in Florida, the making of Panama hats, and how drivers are kept safe in the world's longest tunnel.

programme.title: Embarrassing Fat Bodies
programme.desc: Doctors Christian Jessen, Dawn Harper and Pixie McKenna offer medical advice to people who are or have been overweight to help solve issues caused by their shape. In the first programme, the team helps a man whose stomach touches the floor and a woman whose successful slimming has resulted in excess skin.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Police link the disappearance of a motel worker to a trail of blood, but although they believe they have found the perpetrator, they struggle to locate the victim.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of University of Florida student Christian Aguilar, who vanished from his campus in September 2012. Police were stumped until CCTV footage took the case in a shocking new direction, helping lead them to the 18-year-old's body.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murders of Michael and Valerie Miller, shot dead in the kitchen of their Maine home in November 2009. Nathaniel Nightingale, a friend of the couple's son, claimed his gun went off by accident when he shot Michael Miller, and that he shot Valerie in panic.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A land developer's wife goes missing, and investigators soon become suspicious of an overly helpful neighbour.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride who loves peacocks and another who loves purple battle with their bridesmaids, while another prays pink dresses will save her wedding day.

programme.title: Ruebenland
programme.desc: Welsh school boy and internet sensation Reuben is chasing his dream of becoming famous. He reflects on the bullying he has endured both online and in real life..

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown treats a dog with a growth on its leg. However, after a thorough examination he finds a second lump in its mammary glands that could prove to be more sinister.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Pageant queen Anastagia wants to choose her own dress, but first she needs to battle her mother's influence. Lisa clashes with her mum over an ivory gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Katie's sister persuades her to ditch the tomboy look, Courtney searches for a ball gown and Jennifer orders a dress too small for her to make her lose weight.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Jessica wants a gown to satisfy her conservative fiance but her family has other ideas. Tracy is looking for a deal but her friend is unimpressed with the sale rack.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown gets an emergency night call when a dog is hit by a taxi, but the animal is traumatised and suffering from a punctured lung.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: When an alligator swallows a plastic bottle, Chris Brown must catch it and put his hand down the reptile's throat to clear any obstructions.

programme.title: Animal Cops Miami
programme.desc: Investigators resolve to get justice for a neglected dog and its puppy, and agent Casadevall helps members of the canine population suffering in the Miami heat.

programme.title: Animal Cops Miami
programme.desc: Animal services investigators join the police as they hunt for a serial cat killer.

programme.title: Celebrity Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and Jay Blades scour the homes of Louise Minchin and Chris Hollins for items they can transform and sell on to raise money for charity.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Insight into handwriting analysis, a technique helping to profile criminals and verify suicide notes.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 19-year-old Logan Schiendelman, who vanished after a night out. When authorities found no evidence of foul play, they were forced to examine his family's controversial past.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 23-year-old Amy Bradley, who vanished in March 1998 while on a family cruise through the Caribbean. Her disappearance came after a night out dancing in the ship's disco.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Randy Just Showed You the Door!
programme.desc: Twins Marlo and Margo visit the bridal salon, but a major secret threatens to sabotage the fitting. Plus, bride-to-be Val wants a gown suitable for her icy wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: A Dress to Match My Black Heart
programme.desc: Feisty Camila's desire to buy a black dress may push her equally fiery mother over the edge. Elsewhere, it remains to be seen whether Ally's second custom dress will arrive in time.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride's father hijacks her shopping trip, vetoing numerous dress options. Meanwhile, another woman clashes with her bridesmaids after an argument.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.sub-title: Say Yes to the Short Dress
programme.desc: A bride battles her 'Honorary Brides Man' for control of her dress, while a same-sex couple fight over picking a colour.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A woman wants fur muffs but her maid of honour is not keen. Meanwhile, a bride's friend refuses to be a maid unless she gets the dress she wants.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Two brides leave their maids to choose their own dresses, but Lori has to take control to make sure they do not go down the aisle looking too unusual.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard continues his search for valuable scrap items in the UK, visiting an antique dealer whose stock includes a lamp that could make his entire trip worthwhile. He also searches for treasures in a Somerset estate's coach house.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore salvages three items from a recycling centre in Witley, Surrey, with Kev Paxton and Anthony Devine helping her transform a cooker hood, a sofa and a collection of jars.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Twenty nine-year-old twins Brandi and Kandi are close after a traumatic childhood, seeing food as a comfort. After weight-loss surgery, more challenges await the pair.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: The Browns prepare for their commitment celebration but a disastrous dress rehearsal threatens to ruin the day for Kody and his four wives.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Say Yes to the Dress: The 12 Dresses of Christmas
programme.desc: Randy looks back at beautiful festive bridal looks, counting down his 12 favourite Christmas styles.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.desc: In the 1980s and '90s, there were around 200 murders and attacks on sex workers across the Midlands. Stafford man Alun Kyte was later found to be responsible.
